_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Ice Cream and Frozen Dessert Manufacturing

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Ben & Jerry's, Waterbury, Vermont, has and will continue to be concerned with all aspects of the enviornment, health, and safety issues.  Because of the nature of ice-cream based products, the manufacturing process at Ben & Jerry's includes refrigeration systems to ensure that the ice cream products remain in their intended frozen states.



Ben & Jerry's utilizes two types of refrigeration systems:  anhydrous ammonia and ethylene glycol.  The anhydrous ammonia triggers the requirements of EPA 40 CFR Part 68 - Risk Management Plan - because the facility's refrigeration system has greater than 10,000 pounds of anhydrous ammonia.



Ben & Jerry's Homemade, Inc., is involved in an ongoing effort to comply with OSHA 1910.119 Process Safety Management requirements as well as EPA 40 CFR Part 68 Risk Management Plan for accident prevention planning, training and response.  Our facility is located at 1281 Waterbury-Stowe Rd., Vermont 05676.



Releases are prevented by a combination of engineering and administrative controls.  Administrative controls involve manual isolation and shutdown procedures to be performed by trained personnel.  The system is also equipped with pressure relief valves that operate to prevent damage to system components should pressure reach unsafe levels.  Operation of pressure relief valves will result in a controlled release of refrigerant.



This facility has not experienced any reportable accidents in the past five (5) years.  Incidental releases may occur during routine engineering activities.



Written emergency procedures are maintained at our facility.  All employees are trained to act based on their pre-assigned roles during emergency situations.  The Ben & Jerry's Waterbury facility works with the Waterbury Fire Department Fire Chief/Emergency Management coordinator in the event of an emergency.



Planned changes to improve safety include the ongoing preventative maintenance program, and regular replacement of deteriorated system compone
nts.  Employee level of awareness is enhanced by regular training programs and exercises.
